Detailed Description

TREX Predicate.

This class defines predicate as manipulated by TREX. A predicate is an abstract representaion of Goal and/or Observation exchanged between reactors. It is a named predicate attached to an object with different attributes represented as Variable.

The object is the name of the timeline supporting this observation while the predicate is the value of the state for object

A goal has just the specificity to also define the start, duration and end temporal attributes.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

typedef TREX::utils::XmlFactory< Predicate, boost::shared_ptr<Predicate> > TREX::transaction::Predicate::xml_factory

XML parsing factory for predicates.

This defines a factory that allows to parse Predicate classes from XML.

bool TREX::transaction::Predicate::hasAttribute ( TREX::utils::Symbol const &  name  )  const [inline]

Check for constrained attribute.

Parameters:
name an attribute This methodsw checks if current instance explicitely defines the attribute name
Return values:
true if an attribute name is defined
false otherwise
Note:
the fact that a Predicate instance does not have an attribute just means that this attribute has not been constrained yet using the restrictAttribute method. It is mostly used to check for attribute existence when one wants to access to the domain associated to this attribute
See also:
Variable const &getAttribute(TREX::utils::Symbol const &) const

Definition at line 224 of file Predicate.hh.

void Predicate::listAttributes ( std::list< TREX::utils::Symbol > &  attr,
bool  all = true 
) const [virtual]

List predicate's attributes.

attr A varaible to store the attribute names all A flag used to indicate whether it should list all existing attributes or only the ones with restricted domains (ie not full) This method is adding the list of all the attributes names defined for this predicate at the end of attr. The all flag allows to indicate that we want all the defined attributes even if their domain is full (meaning thay are not really constrained)

Postcondition:
attr list contains all the attributes appendded to it end

Reimplemented in TREX::transaction::Goal.

TREX::utils::Symbol const& TREX::transaction::Predicate::object (  )  const [inline]

Predicate object.

This method indicates which object this predicate is associated to. In TREX this object has to be the name of a timeline shared between reactors.

Returns:
the name of the associated object

std::ostream & Predicate::toXml ( std::ostream &  out,
size_t  tabs = 0 
) const

XML output.

Parameters:
out An output stream
tabs desired tags indentation

This method writes an XML form of current instance to out indented using tab.

The output excludes all the attributes that are not really constrained to reduce the size of this description.

Returns:
out after the operation
